intro: Lasiospora eriolaena, commonly known as the silky lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly growth of white to pale yellow filaments, which give it a distinctive, fluffy appearance. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which allows it to thrive on rock surfaces in temperate and arctic regions. It is typically found in shaded, moist environments, often on tree trunks or soil. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
